verses.roman:
śānta-dāsya-rase aiśvarya kāhāṅ uddīpana
vātsalya-sakhya-madhure ta' kare saṅkocana

synonyms: śānta-dāsya-rase—in the transcendental mellows of neutrality and servitude; aiśvarya—opulence; kāhāṅ—somewhere; uddīpana—manifested; vātsalya-sakhya-madhure—in fraternal love, paternity and conjugal love; ta'-certainly; kare—does; saṅkocana—minimizing.
translation: "On the transcendental platform of neutrality and service, sometimes the opulence of the Lord is prominent. However, in the transcendental mellows of fraternal, paternal and conjugal love, the opulence is minimized.
